methodology.source: Pre-extracted exposures from research-review-report.md (18 HIGH severity findings)
methodology.probability_weighting: Per-finding analyst estimates with P10/P50/P90 distribution for ranges
methodology.correlation_adjustment: Applied to environmental-insurance pairs, regulatory-litigation pairs

labor_relations.description: ILWU strike risk, WARN Act obligations

environmental_regulatory.description: Sierra Club litigation, IMO GHG/CII mandates, NOAA NRD

finance_maritime_liens.description: Ship mortgage refinancing, DVB Bank acceleration

litigation.description: Section 905(b) Martinez verdict and fleet-wide exposure

insurance_coverage.description: MEL gap, LHWCA re-authorization, BWMS exclusion

jones_act_compliance.description: COSCO offshore wind vessels stranded assets

port_lease_gain.description: Oakland lease walk-away net EBITDA gain

exposure_ranges.note: P50 represents probability-weighted expected exposure; P90 used for escrow sizing

examples: Sierra Club CAA settlement: $226M-$306M (ONE_TIME capital, 5-year phased)
Offshore wind COSCO vessels: $35M-$64M (ONE_TIME stranded asset)
Coast Guard drydock fleet: $82.15M (5-year enhanced maintenance)
Ship mortgage refinancing: $42M-$98M annual increase (assumes 7-year amortization)
multi_year_exposures.dcf_methodology: 8% discount rate applied to multi-year cash flows

examples: Ship mortgage debt service increase: $42M-$98M annually (PERPETUAL if refinanced)
LHWCA premium increase: $5M-$9M annually (PERPETUAL if DOL denies self-insurance)

pairs_adjusted.rationale: Both environmental liabilities stem from LA Terminal operations, likely settled together
pairs_adjusted.method: Count NOAA at 50% if Sierra Club settles (assumed partial overlap in negotiations)

pairs_adjusted.rationale: Same root cause: BWMS lifecycle risk across fleet; insurance gap is subset of drydock exposure
pairs_adjusted.method: Already counted in Coast Guard drydock total; remove BWMS insurance double-count

pairs_adjusted.rationale: Same incident: Martinez case coverage gap IS the exposure if no MEL exists
pairs_adjusted.method: Count once at maximum; MEL gap is contingent on Martinez verdict adverse

pairs_adjusted.rationale: Both revenue disruption risks with partial overlap (strike could trigger VSA concerns)
pairs_adjusted.method: Reduce combined impact by correlation × overlap: $1.03B → $977.5M weighted

correlation_adjustments.methodology_note: Correlation matrix applied per Phase 3.5 protocol; same root cause = 1.0 correlation (count once at max), domain overlap = 0.3-0.7 correlation (partial reduction)

escrow_analysis.calculation_basis: HIGH severity total ($2.05B weighted) × 0.12 (12% holdback) + buffer for largest single exposure (Sierra Club $306M × 0.5)
escrow_analysis.minimum_basis: Largest single exposure (Sierra Club $306M) × 0.5 coverage ratio
escrow_analysis.time_horizon_note: 3-year standard escrow adequate for most ONE_TIME exposures, but PERPETUAL liabilities (Section 905(b) fleet-wide $28.5M-$57M annually) require special indemnity or R&W insurance wrap
escrow_analysis.recommended_release_schedule: 25% at 12 months (FMC/Martinez resolution), 30% at 24 months (Sierra Club settlement target), 45% at 36 months (fleet performance validation)
adequacy_flags: Escrow covers P50 expected exposure at 13.7% ratio (standard range 10-20%)
Largest single exposure (Sierra Club $306M gross) covered at 91.5% ratio
PERPETUAL liabilities not fully covered by time-limited escrow; recommend R&W insurance for Section 905(b) tail coverage

test_1_coverage_ratio.interpretation: 13.7% coverage falls within standard 10-20% range for PE maritime acquisitions

test_2_largest_exposure.interpretation: Escrow covers 91.5% of largest single exposure (Sierra Club $306M gross); combined with insurance covers 100%

test_3_time_horizon.recommendation: Standard 3-year escrow aligns with ONE_TIME exposures (8 findings), but 5 PERPETUAL exposures require supplemental R&W insurance or special indemnity

by_category.release_condition: Settlement within range OR 24 months post-closing

by_category.basis: 75 days crew wages (2,400 mariners × $75K avg × 2.5 months)

by_category.release_condition: Verdict/settlement + P&I coverage confirmation + MEL policy verified

by_category.basis: Liquidity buffer if debt/EBITDA covenant breached post-acquisition (6 months debt service)
by_category.release_condition: 12-month debt service reserve maintained, covenant compliance validated

by_category.basis: 15% stress buffer on $180M reserve (PE ownership DOL scrutiny)
by_category.release_condition: Annual actuarial review shows adequacy + DOL OWCP re-authorization

by_category.basis: 10% of $57M-$85M capital mandate (closing condition holdback for commitment)
by_category.release_condition: Capital plan approved by lenders + rotor sail contracts executed

option_a_standard_escrow.pros: Covers HIGH severity ONE_TIME exposures, standard PE structure
option_a_standard_escrow.cons: Does not cover PERPETUAL liabilities (Section 905(b) fleet-wide)

option_b_reduced_escrow_plus_rw_insuranc.pros: Covers PERPETUAL liabilities via insurance, lower escrow reduces seller objection
option_b_reduced_escrow_plus_rw_insuranc.cons: Insurance premium upfront cost, claims process for tail liabilities

option_c_hybrid.special_indemnity: Uncapped for MEL coverage gap (if no policy exists)
option_c_hybrid.pros: Balanced approach, targeted insurance for specific risks

escrow_analysis.recommended_structure: Option C (Hybrid): $220M escrow + Section 905(b) R&W insurance + MEL indemnity if gap confirmed

critical_findings.finding: Ship mortgage lender consent (60% approval probability)
critical_findings.rationale: 15% probability all lenders refuse = deal-blocking; requires immediate pre-signing engagement
If no MEL policy exists, Martinez verdict $2M-$5M uninsured + fleet-wide exposure $28.5M-$57M annually partially uninsured
February 13, 2026 closing not feasible; must extend outside date to March 15-April 1, 2026

top_10_exposures.finding: LA Terminal exit (alternative to CAA settlement)
top_10_exposures.note: Mutually exclusive with Sierra Club settlement; correlation = -0.9
Payback 4-12 months from fuel savings; regulatory mandate
8 of 12 complaints already resolved; $500K-$1M settlement likely

top_10_exposures.finding: Ship mortgage refinancing (if lenders refuse consent)
top_10_exposures.note: 25% probability partial refinance, 15% probability full refinance required

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: ILWU 2027 strike risk (35% probability, $474M 90-day revenue loss + $241M customer defection) + WARN Act $27.8M Oakland
VSA termination upon PE ownership (40% capacity loss, $555M revenue impact) + FMC D&D complaints $145.1M disputed
Sierra Club CAA litigation $226M-$306M + IMO GHG Phase 1 $57M-$85M + CII D-rated $39.5M-$55.3M + NOAA NRD $2M-$5M + long-term decarbonization $1.15B-$1.68B (2026-2050)
Ship mortgage lender consent (60% approval with amendments, 25% partial refinance, 15% full refinance $42M-$98M annual increase)
Martinez Section 905(b) verdict $2M-$5M (70% plaintiff win) + fleet-wide exposure $28.5M-$57M annually (P&I deductibles $7M-$14.5M/year uninsured)
MEL coverage gap $2M-$5M Martinez (60% gap probability) + LHWCA DOL re-authorization $5M-$9M annual (40% commercial insurance required) + BWMS machinery breakdown $2M-$4M per incident
Offshore wind COSCO-built vessels $35M stranded investment + $5M-$8M cancellation fees (NOT Jones Act-eligible for U.S. offshore wind)
M/V Pacific Titan hull corrosion $18.7M + fleet-wide drydock $25M-$40M annually + BWMS replacement cycle $16M-$30M (5-year)
Oakland lease walk-away +$63M-$83M EBITDA gain (revenue loss $135M offset by cost savings $118M + LA/LB redeployment $15M-$25M)
Seattle TWIC reader deadline May 8, 2026 (116 days remain); 60-70% probability non-Risk Group A (no mandate); if required and delayed, penalty capped at $78,210
2 vessels short 1 crew member each (73% vs. 75% U.S. crew requirement); correctable in 90 days for $310K annually (NOT $39.6M research plan error)

quantification_methodology.probability_methodology: Per-finding analyst estimates based on historical precedents, regulatory enforcement patterns, and industry benchmarks. Range probabilities calculated using triangular distribution (P10/P50/P90).

time_value_adjustments.multi_year: DCF at 8% discount rate (5-7 year programs)

quantification_methodology.correlation_methodology: Applied correlation matrix: Environmental-Insurance (0.7), Regulatory-Litigation (0.5), Same Root Cause (1.0). Reduced combined exposures by correlation × overlap percentage.

purchase_price_recommendations.basis: Immediate 5-year environmental capital ($356M-$559.5M) + Sierra Club settlement risk premium + IMO GHG Phase 1 mandate

insurance_requirements.rationale: Section 905(b) coverage gap confirmed; Martinez verdict $2M-$5M + fleet-wide exposure $28.5M-$57M annually
BWMS exclusion gap: $2M-$4M per incident across 22-vessel fleet
10-year tail coverage for PERPETUAL Section 905(b) liability beyond 3-year escrow term

lender_consent_conditions.alternative: Bridge financing facility $550M-$800M committed for DVB Bank + one other lender
Equity cure rights + 150 bps rate increase
Subordinate acquisition debt to ship mortgages

adjustments_breakdown.note: Price reduction + escrow not additive; escrow releases over 3 years. Total at-risk capital: $350M reduction + $280M escrow = $630M, with $210M-$245M expected release over 36 months.

deal_blocking_risks.risk: Ship mortgage lender consent refusal (all lenders)
deal_blocking_risks.mitigation: Pre-signing lender engagement + committed bridge financing
Extend outside date to March 15-April 1, 2026 (60-90 day consent period)
Verify HSR filing status immediately; transaction may be exempt

key_assumptions: Jones Act crew shortfall corrected within 90 days for $310K (NOT $39.6M research plan error)
MTSA Seattle TWIC readers: 60-70% probability non-Risk Group A (no mandate); if required, 116 days remain before May 8, 2026 deadline
ILWU strike probability 35% based on 2027 CBA expiration + historical precedent (2002 lockout, 2014-15 slowdowns)
VSA termination probability 35% assumes GLP portfolio non-competitive on Trans-Pacific routes (if competitive, increases to 75%)
Sierra Club settlement probability 65% based on CAA precedents + economic infeasibility defense ($315M uneconomic vs. $40M net EBITDA)
Ship mortgage lender consent: 60% all approve with amendments, 25% partial refinance (DVB Bank), 15% full refinance required
Section 905(b) fleet-wide: 285 annual LHWCA claims × 5-10% conversion rate = 14-29 tort suits/year × $2M avg verdict
CII D-rated vessels: Rotor sails $9M economically superior to scrapping $39.5M-$55.3M (1.2-year payback from fuel savings)
Oakland lease walk-away: Port's $38M counter-offer rejected; redeploy 620K TEU to LA/LB excess 600K TEU capacity
MEL coverage gap: 60% probability PMSC lacks MEL policy separate from P&I (data room verification CRITICAL)
All monetary amounts in USD; exposures represent present value using 8% discount rate for multi-year/perpetual liabilities

assumption_corrections: Jones Act penalties: Reduced from $39.6M (research plan error) to $310K actual (corrective action cost)
MTSA penalties: Reduced from $2.25M-$4.5M (research plan error) to $78K-$106K weighted actual (deadline May 8, 2026, penalty capped)
Total correction: -$41.46M to -$43.68M eliminates two erroneous 'deal-blocking' risks
validation_notes.objectivity_validation: All 11 specialist reports passed objectivity checks (100%): adverse authority cited, counter-arguments presented, uncertainty acknowledged, balanced probabilities
validation_notes.cross_reference_patterns: 18 mandatory cross-domain integrations identified for section writers (ILWU strike → debt covenants, VSA termination → EBITDA, Sierra Club → lease termination, etc.)
validation_notes.insurance_coverage_validation: MEL gap CRITICAL verification required; BWMS machinery breakdown gap confirmed ($800K Pacific Titan exclusion precedent); LHWCA DOL re-authorization 40% commercial insurance risk
validation_notes.timeline_conflict_detected: February 13, 2026 closing NOT feasible (lender/port consents require 60-90 days); realistic closing: March 15-April 1, 2026
